title: 14. Near To The Wild Heart Of Life - Japandroids
text: 8 Songs iTunes Review Japandroids’ expansive third album follows 2012’s Celebration Rock with something steadier and more mature, but no less triumphant. At times—“Midnight to Morning” and the spacious “True Love and a Free Life of Free Will”—their Springsteenian indie rock approaches the stadium-sized grandeur of bands like Foo Fighters and Pearl Jam, bridging the energy and commitment of punk with the ambition of center stage. Biography Formed: 2006 in Vancouver, British Columbia, Cana Genre: Rock Years Active: '00s, '10s Japandroids are an indie garage rock duo from Vancouver comprised of Brian King (guitar) and David Prowse (drums), who share singing duties. Founded in 2006, the band self-released a pair of five-track EPs, All Lies (2007) and Lullaby Death Jams (2008), before making its full-length album debut with Post-Nothing (2009) on the Canadian label Unfamiliar Records.
